contentrichtext.text: The '''United Evangelical Church''' was created in 1891 when some members of the [[Evangelical Association]] left to form the new church. Thirty-one years later the two groups reunited in [[Detroit]] and renamed themselves "The Evangelical Church." (Those congregations who chose not to re-unite formed a body called the [[Evangelical Congregational Church]].) In 1946, the Evangelical Church merged with the [[Church of the United Brethren in Christ|United Brethren in Christ]] at a meeting in [[Johnstown, Pennsylvania|Johnstown, PA]] to form the [[Evangelical United Brethren|Evangelical United Brethren Church]]. This body, in turn, united with the American Methodist Church in 1968 to form the [[United Methodist Church]]. ==See also== *[[:Category:Bishops of the United Evangelical Church]] ==External links== *[http://www.eccenter.com/ Evangelical Congregational Church website] [[Category:Former Christian denominations]] [[Category:Religious organizations established in 1891]] [[Category:Evangelical United Brethren Church]] [[Category:Evangelical denominations and unions established in the 19th century]] [[Category:Methodist denominations and unions established in the 19th century]] [[Category:United Methodist Church predecessor churches]] [[Category:United Methodist Church]] {{Methodist-stub}}
